headline.main: FILM INQUIRY FIGHT DUE OVER EXPENSES; Senator Clark Signs Vouchers for $552 to Submit to the Audit Committee ISSUE MAY GO TO SENATE Lucas, Audit Chairman, Says He Favors $250 Maximum for Unauthorized Hearings

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 21 (AP) -- Controversy within the Senate over the investigation of the movies approached a step nearer a showdown today when Senator Clark of Idaho signed vouchers for $552.04 in expenditures by the Senate Interstate Commerce subcommittee inquiring into alleged war propaganda.
abstract: controversy expected; Sen D W Clark, subcom chmn, signs expense vouchers
